metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 5 axioms covering eventualities, their structure, and generation relations
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and defeasible reasoning

axioms.title: Relation between primed and unprimed predicates
axioms.fol: (forall (x) (iff (p x) (exists (e)(and (p' e x)(Rexist e)))))
axioms.english: p is true of x if and only if there is an eventuality e that is the eventuality of p being true of x and e really exists

axioms.title: Running generates going
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 x) (if (run' e1 x) (exists (e2) (and (go' e2 x)(gen e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Whenever a running event e1 occurs, there is a going event e2 that it generates

axioms.title: First argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn x 1 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then x is the first argument of e

axioms.title: Second argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn y 2 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then y is the second argument of e

axioms.title: Third argument of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn z 3 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of x giving y to z, then z is the third argument of e

axioms.title: Eventuality is self-argument
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(argn e 0 e)))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality of giving, then e is the 0th argument of itself

axioms.title: Constraints on argn arguments
axioms.fol: (forall (e x n) (if (argn x n e)(and (nonNegInteger n)(eventuality e))))
axioms.english: If x is the nth argument of e, then n is a nonnegative integer and e is an eventuality

axioms.title: Definition of eventuality
axioms.fol: (forall (e)(iff (eventuality e)(argn e 0 e)))
axioms.english: Something is an eventuality if and only if it is the 0th argument of itself

axioms.title: Definition of arg predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x) (iff (arg x e)(exists (n)(argn x n e))))
axioms.english: x is an argument of e if it is the nth argument for some n

axioms.title: Definition of arg* predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (x e1) (iff (arg* x e1) (or (arg x e1) (exists (e2)(and (arg e2 e1)(arg* x e2))))))
axioms.english: x is an arg* of e1 if x is an argument of e1, or an argument of an argument of e1, and so on

axioms.title: Predicate of give eventuality
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(pred give e)))
axioms.english: If e is a giving event by x of y to z, then the entity we call give is the pred of e

axioms.title: Pred type constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (pred p e)(and (predicate p)(eventuality e))))
axioms.english: The pred of an eventuality is a predicate and eventualities are eventualities

axioms.title: Arity of give predicate
axioms.fol: (forall (e x y z) (if (give' e x y z)(arity 3 e)))
axioms.english: A giving event has an arity of 3

axioms.title: Arity type constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (n e) (if (arity n e)(and (nonNegInteger n)(eventuality e))))
axioms.english: The arity of an eventuality is a nonnegative integer and eventualities are eventualities

axioms.title: Complete structure of eventualities
axioms.fol: (forall (e) (iff (eventuality e) (exists (p n) (and (pred p e)(arity n e) (forall (i) (if (and (posInteger i) (leq i n)) (exists (x) (argn x i e))))))))
axioms.english: If e is an eventuality, then it has a predicate p, an arity n and n arguments

axioms.title: Gen relation between eventualities
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (gen e1 e2)(and (eventuality e1)(eventuality e2))))
axioms.english: The gen relation is between two eventualities

axioms.title: Gen is antireflexive
axioms.fol: (forall (e) (not (gen e e)))
axioms.english: The gen relation is antireflexive - an eventuality does not generate itself

axioms.title: Gen modus ponens with Rexist
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (and (gen e1 e2)(Rexist e1)) (Rexist e2)))
axioms.english: If e1 generates e2 and e1 really exists, then e2 really exists

axioms.title: Gen is stronger than implication
axioms.fol: (exists (e1 e2) (and (imply e1 e2)(not (gen e1 e2))))
axioms.english: Generation is stronger than implication - there exist events where one implies another but doesn't generate it

axioms.title: Gen preserves temporal location
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 t) (if (gen e1 e2)(iff (atTime e1 t)(atTime e2 t))))
axioms.english: If e1 generates e2, then e1 and e2 occur at the same time

axioms.title: Gen preserves spatial location
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2 x s) (if (gen e1 e2)(iff (atLoc e1 x s)(atLoc e2 x s))))
axioms.english: If e1 generates e2, then e1 and e2 occur at the same location

conversion_notes.axiom_schemas: Several axioms (5.1, 5.3-5.6, 5.11, 5.13) are axiom schemas that need instantiation for each predicate
conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Primed predicates (give', run', go') represent reified eventualities
conversion_notes.recursive_definition: Axiom 5.10 defines arg* recursively using itself
conversion_notes.generation_relation: The gen relation is central to this chapter, relating closely similar eventualities
conversion_notes.self_reference: Eventualities are defined as being the 0th argument of themselves

file_format_notes.completeness: All axioms from Chapter 5 extracted and converted
file_format_notes.validation: All FOL expressions validated for syntactic correctness
